required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telavancin for Treatment of Uncomplicated Staphylococcus Aureus Bacteremia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, Multinational Trial of Intravenous Televancin (TD-6424) for Treatment of Uncomplicated Staphylococcus Aureus Bacteremia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether telavancin (TD-6424, ARBELIC) can be safety administered to patients with bloodstream infections and whether telavancin is effective in treating these infections.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response (Cure, Failure, or Indeterminate) as Determined by the Investigator Based the Presence or Absence of Clinical Signs and Symptoms Associated With Bacteremia, Metastatic Complications, or Positive Culture at the Test of Cure Evaluation
primary_outcome.description: Outcomes in this exploratory study were compared for noninferiority though no specific margin was justified. The 95% CI for the difference was -35.5 to 31.9; further statistical evaluation is not warranted owing to the small sample size.

arm_group.description: Vancomycin 1 Gram/12 hours or nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Gram/6 hours (IV) intravenously

intervention.description: Telavancin 10mg/kg/day IV every 24 hrs for up to 14 days
Vancomycin 1 Gram every 12 hr IV (intravenously) OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Grams every 6 hr IV (intravenously) for up to 14 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Documented S. aureus bacteremia
Exclusion Criteria
- Patients who had received or would have received more than 72 hours of potentially effective systemic antistaphylococcal therapy within 7 days prior to randomization. The following agents were considered potentially effective antistaphylococcal therapy: antistaphylococcal penicillins (including nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin), cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, glycopeptides (including vancomycin and teicoplanin) and linezolid

responsible_party.name_title: Steven L. Barriere, Pharm.D., Vice President, Clinical and Medical Affairs

group.title: Telavancin
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive telavancin 10 mg/kg/day IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes 1 patient who never started therapy.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive vancomycin 1 Gram IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Gram IV (intravenously) every 6 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes one patient who never started therapy.

group.title: Telavancin
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive telavancin 10 mg/kg/day IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes 1 patient who never started therapy.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive vancomycin 1 Gram IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Gram IV (intravenously) every 6 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes one patient who never started therapy.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Clinical Response (Cure, Failure, or Indeterminate) as Determined by the Investigator Based the Presence or Absence of Clinical Signs and Symptoms Associated With Bacteremia, Metastatic Complications, or Positive Culture at the Test of Cure Evaluation
outcome.description: Outcomes in this exploratory study were compared for noninferiority though no specific margin was justified. The 95% CI for the difference was -35.5 to 31.9; further statistical evaluation is not warranted owing to the small sample size.
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analysis was of the CE Population, defined as those patients meeting meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria, meeting continuation criteria, receiving assigned study drug for at least 14 days and available for assessment of response.

group.title: Telavancin
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive telavancin 10 mg/kg/day IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes 1 patient who never started therapy.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive vancomycin 1 Gram IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Gram IV (intravenously) every 6 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes one patient who never started therapy.

measure.title: Clinical Response (Cure, Failure, or Indeterminate) as Determined by the Investigator Based the Presence or Absence of Clinical Signs and Symptoms Associated With Bacteremia, Metastatic Complications, or Positive Culture at the Test of Cure Evaluation
measure.description: Outcomes in this exploratory study were compared for noninferiority though no specific margin was justified. The 95% CI for the difference was -35.5 to 31.9; further statistical evaluation is not warranted owing to the small sample size.
measure.population: The primary efficacy analysis was of the CE Population, defined as those patients meeting meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria, meeting continuation criteria, receiving assigned study drug for at least 14 days and available for assessment of response.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: No margin was justified owing to the exploratory nature of the investigation.

reported_events.time_frame: From receipt of first dose through last follow-up assessment (up to Day 98).

group.title: Telavancin
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive telavancin 10 mg/kg/day IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes 1 patient who never started therapy.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: Patients with uncomplicated Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia were randomized to receive vancomycin 1 Gram IV (intravenously) every 12 hrs OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Gram IV (intravenously) every 6 hrs for up to 14 days. Excludes one patient who never started therapy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Steve Barriere, Pharm.D., Vice President, Clinical and Medical Affairs
